column13: Austin is a great venue for food. 1866 is definitely worth visiting. It is more of a cafe as advertised so the menu is a little limited, but what is available is tasty. Give it a try among several others in the downtown area.

The food was poorly cooked. I had the pork chop, which was baked then grilled. This gave it no flavor from the grill and looked like it had been thawed from day before. The mashed potatoes were perfectly done and the black-eyed peas were thrown around the plate mixed in with the pork chops dejan mustard.
noise level was almost intolerable, but everything else was wonderful.
Great experience. The food and ambiance was great.

The pork confit was the best meal I'd had in a long time, and the fried artichokes were wonderful. I received a free dessert for my birthday, and the tiramisu rivaled any I'd had in Italy. It has a cool, modern atmosphere, but the main star is the food, which is simply superb.
Went there for Easter brunch. Food was fresh and tasty. Portions were large. Coffee was excellent although the cups were too small!

column4: 203 East San Antonio Street Fredericksburg, TX  78624
column13: The Bloody Mary's are awesome. Our waiter couldn't have been nicer. I recommend the egg rolls for sure. Personally the soft shell crab I thought was OK. Would go back for sure!
Amazing. Been going for over a year on a regular basis, always love the meal and service.

column1: Bob's Steak and Chop House - Austin
column13: Our dinner was great, service was outstanding and the whole experience was a wonderful time for us all. The desert was OUTSTANDING and HUGE one for the whole table was plenty. I will definately return for anther visit.

Great place and great food...but entirely too loud and noisy. Even the waiters were having problems hearing the customers and were apologizing for the noise. This is a great place for a fun evening with wonderful food. But DO NOT go there if you are wanting a romantic or quiet evening of conversation.

While the food is yummy, it's a bit rich for an Austin summerâ€”most dishes seem to rely on cream as a main ingredient. I also noticed that two dishes seem to have the same sauce, which is kind of not cool on a 4-course prix fixe menu, especially one so heavy (not to mention pricey).
This place is a hidden gem. Accent on the hidden. It is in a remote area of Lago Vista behind a security gate upstairs in a parking garage with limited signage as to its whereabouts.
Food and service was wonderful.

Enjoyed a Quiet and Romantic Birthday Dinner at Cafe Josie! The food was very good. Our waiter was outstanding! Enjoyed our walk through the Old West Austin neighborhood as we made our way from our hotel (downtown) to the restaurant. Be sure to save room for dessert as the Chocolate Pot is not to be missed!

column4: 3421 W. William Cannon Dr., #127 Austin, TX  78745
column13: The service was great. My table was ready and I was even able to select a different table once I arrived.

Dined last Friday Night with a group from Work.Food was originally prepared, flavorful and a joy to eat.Be sure to save room for the Apple Pie and Ice Cream. Forget your diet and share some with others.
Exceeded my expectations given its position as a "hotel restaurant" at UT, but food was creative, presented well and very tasty.

The food was ok - extensive wine list. Ordered a creme brulee for dessert - not sure what it was - tasted more like a pudding with maybe nuts in it??? Couldn't figure out what that was. We were there on a Sunday night - service was good. Appetizer was good -and the pasta dishes were good.

You cannot go wrong eating at Chez Zee. The Thursday pork special is wonderful, as is the New Orleans pecan chicken, and the chicken Cezar salad. The desserts are some of the best in town. It is my "go-to" restaurant for meetings and when I just want to grab a quick dinner close to home.

My mother was in town and I took her to Cipollina. For both of us, it was our first visit. We were very impressed with the food, service and overall atmosphere. I had the salad with brie, strawberries and walnuts - delicious! We both had the red fish entree and it was divine - the fingerling potato salad was the perfect accent. To top it off we shared the cobbler for dessert. I will be back soon to try the pizza.
Love it. The food is amazing and the location and building is awesome.

The excellent service was the highlight of this meal. The food was all very interesting. The insights of the staff was informative. We were concerned about the price, but it was not as bad as expected. Overall a very nice evening.

It was my first visit and we had a group. I thought it may be too hot to be outdoors but it was quite pleasant with the shade and fans/mister. Reservation process worked well. Waitress was very helpful with food, drink recs. Bottles of water (witout asking) while we perused menu were nice touch. We tried about six food menu items and several types of drinks and all were good or great. Prices were reasonable. I will go back and recommend it to others.

Went to cool river for our 9yr anniversity. When the waiter asked and I told him why we were there all we got was a ho-hum kinda responce. We also noted how empty the place was on a Sat. night. I made reservations BUT PLENTY of tables! I felt like an idiot for making reservations there. Not needed, nobody will be there! I think the way over the top prices, the lack of entre' choices, and boring atmosphere had something to do with it. We did not even want to go into the bar/dance area. Looked boring in there as well. So,for the price ($100 for 2, no drinks) to eat just "a steak" nothing special about it, I will go to Roadhouse and eat like a king (with two sides)for half the price. Again pretty "Grey" place to go. two thumbs way down

We had a great time. It was international night and we watched belly dancers, flamingo, and some Hindu performers as well. Everyone very attentive. The manager brought us champagne even though it was not on the menue drinks list. The manager knew that we were celebrating my husband's birthday so he made it more special for us. Wonderful experience. Can't wait to go back.
Very knowledgeable, well-informed wait staff.

column4: 4404 W William Cannon Dr., Ste L Austin, TX  78749
column13: Good cajun food. Jumbalaya was nice and spicy.

column4: 11506 Century Oaks Terrace Suite 100 Austin, TX  78758
column13: Our waiter was Marque. He is awesome. This restaurant never disappoints. We definitely recommend the Daily Grill.

Always good here. Nathan, the sommelier and Brent our fine waiter run a tight ship. The decor is wonderfully old school and the lighting just right. Really good ceasar salad, rather too creamy truffle and garlic bisque and rather too much of it - good quail stuffed with cornbread and then a desert that frankly was not good at all - having mentioned that it was immediately repalced by a delightful chcocolate one and we were told "it wont be on the menu again" - I like a place that listens earnestly to feedback!Wine list is always excellent and reasonable - except for the rediculously priced Chateau Musar - $300 here and $80 elsewhere - drop the price, move the stock!Having said all that we always do enjoy dining here!
We had a very nice evening at Eddie V in Austin.

We were taken to our table upon arrival. The service was excellent. The food delicious but it was too cold. We had to ask twice to fix it because eating having cold it's not nice. Other than this, we had a great night
I've been to El Naranjo 4 times now and have always enjoyed the food.

column4: 3801 N Capital of Texas Hwy Ste. C-200 Austin, TX  78746
column13: food was good, but server was overwhelmed and never caught up

column4: 10000 Research Blvd. Suite B Austin, TX  78759
column13: We had the best time. It was my son's girlfriend's birthday and we wanted to do something special for her. We had promised our son and daughter we would try this restaurant and we thought this would be a great time to try it. Food and service was excellent. We also appreciated the Manager coming to our table to ask how everything was and if there was anything we thought they could change or do better.

column4: Hilton Austin 500 E 4th St. Austin, TX  78701
column13: Was dissapointed at first. Web site indicates special cottails but no cottail menu. Web site menus have a lot more than the actual menu. However, cottails we ordered and food we ordered was good. Steaks overcooked to med rare order.

Sometimes, in Austin, it can be difficult to find a place that either is too noisy or too crowded to truly enjoy dinner...Fino solved both these inconveniences for us. This was my first visit and my wife's second visit to Fino. I enjoyed it immensely ! Everything was just perfect...starting with our seating, the ambiance, food and service. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a nice, quiet, out of the way spot to have a most pleasurable dining experience.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Austin
column13: Good steak. The vegetable sides were awesome. Definitely plan to come back.

column1: Fleming's Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar - Austin The Domain
column13: Just excellent food and service all the way around!

column4: 900 Ranch Rd 620 S, Ste B108 Lakeway, TX  78734
column13: Food was very good, I got the brick oven chicken and the seasoning was delicous. My husband got the Coconut Shrimp and also enjoyed the sweet and slightly spicy sauce. Definately will go back.
This was my best brunch meal ever. The food was fresh and delicious. Hope to go back and enjoy the outdoor deck.

More than two hours for a dinner without deseert or coffee. Service was horible. the food was not great enough to return to such bad service. We saw other reviews on bad service but thought perhaps it was just a bad night and would give it our own chance at service. That did not prove to be worthwhile. We will not return.

column1: Gumbo's Steak and Seafood - Bee Cave
column13: Read some poor reviews but decided to try it anyway. Very glad we did. Great food and service! Wasn't too happy with the seating though. Requested a booth and while I saw 2 open ones, we were seated in between other tables at the entrance of the dining room. My husband was bumped multiple times due to the small walking space. They need to remove that table before someone ends up getting a plate or two dumped on their head. Could definitely happen! Overall... very glad we went and will go back soon. Hope they have the same entertainment, guy was awesome on the acoustic guitar!

column4: 4800 Burnet Road Suite B-200 Austin, TX  78756
column13: Enjoyed a great meal with friends. Arrived during happy hour, while it was still a little slow (and quiet). As it got later, the restaurant became very loud and a bit difficult to hear. Great specials and 1/2 price bottles of wine during happy hour. We shared several appetizers and a pizza. All of the food was fantastic. Our server was friendly and helpful. He was busy and a little bit unavailable, but was easily waved down. All in all a grea experience.
Great cocktail list. My husband had the chicken...amazing.

column4: 500 Cypress Creek Rd., Ste 170 Cedar Park, TX  78613
column13: Was a groupon purchase. Had a very nice time and enjoyed the food. Perfect early dinner on a quiet Sunday.

column4: 2000 S. IH 35 Suite D-1 Round Rock, TX  78681
column13: I ordered short ribs and they had a grimy after taste. The hamburger my husband ordered was good and the kids meals were good. We will return.

We've been here 4 or 5 times now. The food is always excellent, as is the service. The waiter made some recommendations and he did not steer us wrong. The drinks we had from the bar were supberb, the wine pairing with the Elk was excellent, as recommended. It's quite a treat to experience the fine dining here.
We always enjoy the food at Hugos and proximity to Zach Theater is a plus when we are going to a play.
There is a new head chef, and so some new menu items.There are definitely some tasty new favorites to be discovered.

column1: Hyde Park Bar & Grill - West Gate
column4: 4521 B West Gate Blvd Austin, TX  78745
column13: We took our NYC children to Hyde Park. One got the hamburger, and one got the 4 vegetable plate. They were both very pleased. My daughter especially liked the collard greens.
Incredible food, pepper steak was excellent. One of the best steak houses in America.
sit at the bar where the sushi is made....the chefs are very friendly and informative...lots of fun....great food

My boyfriend and I went for our anniversary. We wanted to try something new and quiet to enjoy a romantice night. It was really nice! Food was good, waitor was very knowledgeable in the menu which helped with our selections for the night. Overall really good experience, we will recommend to any other couples seeking a romantic dinner.
well executed,fresh ingredients, good value for money, needs to be more adventurous
Outstanding dinner, there were five of us and everyone enjoyed the food...located in a historic home very quaint and charming.

column4: 11410 Century Oaks Terrace The Domain Austin, TX  78758
column13: Was generally pleased with the food and service was great as usual. The fish tacos (blackened catfish I believe) were not very tasty one their own without the accompanying sauce. Could not really taste the fish or the blackening spices, which should not be the case. Was a little disappointed because everything else I have ever eaten at Kona Grill has been fantastic.

Try the delicious chorizo nachos if you're just having bites at the bar; they're strictly served there, not for dinner but they're fantastic. For dinner, try the pork ribs--they're so tender they're practically falling apart, and the light, almost sweet flavor is just delicious.
Food was very good, service was excellent. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful. An enjoyable dining experience.
Good, authentic food. Reasonably priced.
Great dining experience! You are my favorite restaurant.

column4: 118 E. Main St. Round Rock, TX  78664
column13: The service was great. We were a group of six. Some tried the lamb, the duck breast and the small filet. The food was good--just not great. I enjoyed the green beans with sausage that were a side item to the duck breast. My husband noted that he had not seen such small lamb chops before, but added that they "were good". I guess we were expecting more for the price range.
Such a reliable good time and delicious meal! It's always fun eating here with friends. The chile en nogada is an extra special treat.
Great place to meet a friend or for date night.

Overall I had a very enjoyable experience at this restaurant. We started off with the Pan Borracho. The bread itself lacked some seasoning; I don't think the cheese had enough salt to carry the dish. However, the texture was great and the crust on top made it all worth it. For the main course, my husband ordered the fried egg sandwich and loved it. I ordered the brussels sprouts au gratin and the daily special. The brussels sprouts alone would be enough for me to return to this restaurant. Those were the most amazing brussels sprouts I have ever eaten in my life. The special was a smoked lamb shoulder with a pecan puree and steamed pears. The lamb was perfection but the puree was a little bland. PB&J Brownie to die for.

We went to the Domain location for our 39th annual dual anniversary celebration with our very good friends. The menu is has so many different seafood selections we had problems deciding what to get. We ordered the lobster cobb salad, grilled seafood trio, lobster, and rib eye steak along with fried oysters, clam chowder, arugula and beet salad, and lobster bisque. The cobb salad presentation was amazing. All items were delicious. We had rasberry sorbet and a chocolate peanut butter ice cream pie that were fantastic. Our waiters and hostess made us feel very welcome and made a special occasion even more special. We will definitely go back and try some of the other interesting items on the menu.
Great atmosphere, outstanding dessert, had a nice first time experience.
Excellent experience, the shashimi was very good. This is the second time we have been here

Great service from our server. My only annoyance was waiting for a reservation I had made a week in advance. The only reason it got resolved in about 30 minutes from my arrival was another large group did not show - they need a better grip on managing their tables, especially as they had called me and I confirmed.
Good selection, reasonably attentive staff

The room we were in was not "energetic" it was absolutely LOUD. A table near us was SO loud it was hard to hear the conversation at my own table. Chalk it up to bad acoustics in the upstairs dinning room, and lack of volume control on the part of the 3 couples sitting at the room's center table--consider seating those loud mouths outside next time--unless your neighbors may complain too!
Nice ambience and great food/service, but slightly overpriced as it seems more like a casual bar hangout than fancy dinner.
We don't care for the scene on sixth street but the food was great and would come back for sure

column4: 1400 S Congress Suite B100 Austin, TX  78704
column13: Our server Chris was amazing. We had tons if questions and he was very helpful. The oysters were out of this world.

We've been eating at Perry's since 2005, starting in Houston and now in Austin. The Pork Chop, carved tableside, is a standard any time we have a celebration at Perry's. We've tried many items on the menu and all have been flavorful and of top quality. A new find I'm trying to copy at home is the Spicy Calamari, served with Jalapenos and, I think, bacon.Service, from the Hostess thru the Waiter and all the way to the Busboy, is always the best. Courteous above all, attentive but not hovering, proper and pleasant...the best.We recommend Perry's highly and often.
We always have a wonderful experience here. Excellent food, service, vibe!!
Very Nice, Great Location, Excellent Food
The steak was promised to "pass the Pepsi taste test"; it was a pedestrian steak and the seasoning was nothing special. A very over-priced meal.

column4: 107 W. 6th Street The Scarborough Building Austin, TX  78701
column13: Excellent cuisine!!
A wonderful meal in a great restaurant. The service was great,the food and drink were superb, and I can't wait to visit again.

Great find. The location is in a strip mall and therefore could be missed by many driving by, but worth the stop. Great Mexican food, more traditional Mexican than texmex. Great margaritas as well . Did make reservations online and had to wait for a table, while walk Ins were seated before wa us however it was only about five minutes wait .

column4: 3202 W. Anderson Lane Ste #205 Austin, TX  78757
column13: Always enjoy our dining here. Clean and friendly atmosphere.
This is one of the best brunch selections in Austin. Give it a try!

We decided to try the Shore Club, b/c the menu looked impressive, and we knew it had to have a great view. We made a reservation, and were surprised to find a "seat yourself" atmosphere upon arrival. The tables inside were rather scattered and shabby. Surprisingly, the deck outside had the nicest tables. But, it was too hot to enjoy. We found the restaurant to be very noisy, dark, and uncomfortably warm. Our waitress was pleasant, although overworked with too many tables. She did her best considering her situation, but was not very attentive. Our food looked impressive when it arrived. But, overall the dishes were bland and ordinary. We will not be back. FYI, worst parking situation I've ever seen!

column4: 6203 Capital of Texas Hwy Austin, TX  78731
column13: Great ambience and the service was good but the food was very sub par, especially considering the price. My ravioli main course was $18 and it was overcooked and swimming in a boring, bland tomato sauce. This was my second visit (and will be my last) and the food has disappointed both times.
Food was great but service was really poor.

We thought the food was very good. Not only were the steaks excellent and cooked as ordered(you need to try the hickory smoked flovoring)but the prices were very reasonable considering the food quality and the ambiance. The portions were good and the sides were delicious. The wonderful lake views and a fantastic band were also a big plus. Combine that with an attentive wait staff and complimentary valet service made it a perfect night for a very special anniversary evening

column1: Stories Fine Dining Establishment at Hyatt Regency Lost Pines
column4: 575 Hyatt Lost Pines Rd. Cedar Creek, TX  78612
column13: the balcony more quiet and intimate with the firepit just outside/below. the staff was friendly and attentive, although we didn't get our bread until after the main meal was served. The tasty onion jam made up for it. they were accomodating to special dietary needs. the quail was fantastic although the antelope could have used a little salt. Buffalo burger was ok. the truffled mac and cheese was thick and perfectly truffled. The wine list, although limited by the glass, the ones offered were of quality and well matched to the fare. I do wish they had a tasting menu to let the chef do more than an amuse, and the burger is better for lunch. perhaps a poultry dish offering instead (like just the quail by itself)!

The experience was fantastic! Our server David was great, as was the rest of the staff and their quiet attention to us. The food was splendid, beginning with our drinks, and especially the entree and desserts. We had a great time dining with you.

Sushi Zushi is our " go to" restaurant. Anyone can find something they'd like to eat on the extensive menu. The decor is pleasant and most of the time the noise level is fine. The lighting is good. Service is very good.
The sushi menu ranges from traditional to southwest flair -- everything we had was excellent! Service was fantastic. We'll definitely go to Sushi Zushi again!

This was recommended to me by a GSR at another hotel, and it was the worst experience I've ever had, bar none. We only saw our server twice, but when she brought us the check, she was friendly as can be. It took 45 minutes to get our food and we got it before people who were there far before we were. It seemed as though the staff and kitchen couldnt handle the magnitude of service that was there. You should probably get an entire new crew. I went down to the concierge, who was probably the friendliest person I came across. Kudos to her. She was the only person who made us feel welcome in the entire place.

I LOVE SWIFT'S! One night after my boyfriend and I had been down at the Elephant Room, we happened into Swifts and were blown away with the menu, the feel, the staff, the drinks, the food... everything! My friend from LA was in town this past weekend and I wanted to treat her to an amazing night out, so we made late reservations for Friday night. It took quite some time to actually GET to the table, but we had drinks at the bar (YUM!) and some appetizers. The owner, CK, came round to make sure that we were OK since we were still not at our table (the people at the table we were to sit at were kinda camping out and enjoying their night - - not the restaurant's fault!) and comped our appetizers for us! We finally sat and enjoyed a lovely meal
Overall, great food, fantastic service and a great location.
We have been here before and just loved it! My 80 year old parents came into town and I couldn't wait to take them there. Was a wonderful, quiet lunch. Will be back for sure.
BEST DINNER EVER!!!I will be going back soon

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Austin Arboretum
column13: Excellent service, food was great and the piano player was awesome. Recognized our birthday girl with a complimentary dessert.Enjoyed the night.

column1: Truluck's Seafood, Steak and Crab House - Austin Downtown
column13: We can always count on delicious food, great service, wonderful wine list, and all our favorite brands behind the bar. We enjoyed the impecable service provided by Kinsey last Saturday night. She made the evening all the more special with her knowledge of the food preparations and recommendations.
The food was outstanding, as was the service. Everyone knew their jobs and were professional, yet also made sure to interact with the guests and make the visit fun.

column4: 4200 N Lamar Blvd. Suite 140 Austin, TX  78756
column13: Food at uchiko was absolutely wonderful as was service. Dinning area was decorated incredibly nicely and the ambiance would Have been amazing except for the group of people who were all but yelling. Overall good experience and would definitely think of going back again.

They have re-done menu again and it is ever better now. The nice thing for people with food sensitivities is that they basically fix everything after it is ordered so items can be left out or substituted.

If you are a Longhorn as love all the symbols that represent the school, this is a great place to see! Aside from the HUGE Vince picture (every Longhorn's favorite of course), the pictures are all a representation of what we hold so dear. The food was AMAZING. I have a complicated cooking style that I like and they got it right the first time! Not many can do that. Our waiter was attentive without being annoying and he made some really good suggestions. In addition, the food came out at perfect times. I defiantly want to return...maybe in December for the next big occasion :-)

column4: 1014 North Lamar Blvd. Ste. E Austin, TX  78703
column13: I loved Wink! I took my boyfriend here for his birthday, and we had a wonderful time. We were greeted immediately, met the matradee who was very friendly and led to our table where we were given personalized menus that said "happy birthday, garrett" on them! Our food was amazing, our server was very friendly and knowledgable. He made great food recommendations and suggested great wine pairings too. I would highly recommend Wink for a romantic dinner.
We were there on the 14th of September and had a great waiter! The food was wonderful, and I really love the atmosphere.
We tried four appetizers. I liked the Ahi bites but would have liked to have the Ahi mixture separate from the chips. Good flavors but would like a few more choices without fried components.
This is one of our favorites in the world... always a new dish - always fun.
Great service staff. nice interior. great food.
